page.title: 15Scouts and Guides
page.content: Brownsea is famous as the place where the{first-ever Scout camp,}organised in 1907 by Lord Baden-Powell, was held, and during 1985 there have been celebrations on the island to commemorate the 75th. anniversary of the{Girl Guides}(founded 1910). The original campsite on Brownsea, plus the South Shore Lodge, continue to be used by Scouts and Guides. During the 1985 season 22 groups have booked the South Shore Lodge, including Guides from British Columbia, Canada. In July 1985 there were 18 Guides from the 31st and 32nd St. Matthews Guide Company from Northampton, on their 3rd visit to Brownsea. They commented on how unspoilt the island was and on its historic associations with Baden-Powell.
